Continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role,'' Andy Coulson said in an e-mailed statement today. I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Andy Coulson has denied any knowledge of illegal activity when he was editor of Britain's best-selling Sunday newspaper, from which he resigned after a reporter and a private investigator were imprisoned for phone-tapping in 2007.
